image.altText: A woman hangs up stringed up sausages to dry

props.synopsis: Sausage-making is an unshakable tradition for many Italian families but the ritual is about so much more than a full belly, with young Australians like Angela Caiazza sharing nonni-inspired recipes on social media.

title.children: 'Pig day' is popular among young Italian-Australians, and social media is spreading the tradition

image.altText: A house under construction.

props.synopsis: Potential home buyers, builders, property developers, the state government and SA Water are bonded together by a common problem; the water and sewage networks in Adelaide's northern suburbs are maxed out, writes Rory McClaren.

title.children: Demand for water is as lucrative as houses in Adelaide's north. The solutions are neither quick or cheap

image.altText: A photo showing an Indigenous woman sitting in a chair outside with building in the background.

props.synopsis: A first-of-its-kind renal dialysis clinic has opened in remote Central Australia, a region where one in 100 people are in need of the treatment amid a growing diabetes and kidney disease epidemic.

title.children: After three years away from home, Raelene can now have dialysis on country

image.altText: Olivia Frazer from 2022 season of MAFS

props.synopsis: Olivia went on Australia's biggest show to find love, but lost almost everything. She says she got a "villain edit" — so do they exist?

title.children: 'I signed up to be a b****, not a criminal': Australia's 'most-hated' TV villain speaks

image.altText: Extensive frost and fog covers the landscape in Glen Innes on June 19, at sunrise

props.synopsis: As the bitter cold snap continues across central and eastern parts of the country, the Bureau of Meteorology reveals which places have had the most extreme temperatures during this event, and which towns lay claim as Australia's coldest in general.

title.children: These places lay claim to being the coldest in Australia, as the bitter cold snap continues

image.altText: A young woman in a red jumper and large round glasses with long blonde hair and a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Failings by two of Australia's major IVF companies allowed a man to keep donating sperm over several years using different names. Katherine Dawson is now urgently trying to find her half-siblings.

title.children: Katherine's sperm donor father could have created up to 700 children. She has a message for the IVF clinics responsible

image.altText: Blurred image of an army vehicle

props.synopsis: Israeli soldiers tied a wounded Palestinian to their vehicle and drove him through the city of Jenin as Palestinians filmed the incident.

title.children: Israeli soldiers who drove with wounded Palestinian tied to their vehicle 'violated orders', military says

image.altText: A sad-looking Putin, viewed from the side.

props.synopsis: When Vladimir Putin announced a military partnership with North Korea, he stepped across a red line drawn by one of the most advanced arms suppliers in the world.

title.children: While he was trying to make a friend in North Korea, Putin angered a very important player to the south

image.altText: A man standing near a garage door, looking down, with a cigarette in his hand.

props.synopsis: Fourteen years of austerity measures and cuts to services haven't just left people feeling forgotten in Scotland's largest city — research has revealed the policies mean people are dying younger.

title.children: Inside the 'devastating effect' of austerity measures on a Scottish city

image.altText: Text message scree in front of generic army background

props.synopsis: An independent inquiry into an ill-fated MRH-90 Taipan crash reveals the mindset of soldiers hours before the accident, amid claims of a "toxic" workplace culture.

title.children: Fatal army helicopter crash inquiry reveals gut-wrenching final messages between colleagues

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a suit and glasses, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The federal government has effectively shelved its push to introduce both extraordinary immigration powers and religious discrimination laws, with Labor offering few signs it will seek to deliver on its promised policies before the election.

title.children: Extraordinary immigration powers and religious protections shelved

props.synopsis: Oh, I see — you're back with your tail between your legs after last week's abysmal effort.

title.children: Still think you're a trivia genius? Then let's play … HARD!

image.altText: Crowds walk down a street in Japan covered in colourful billboards.

props.synopsis: As a record number of Australians head to Japan, some restaurants and tourist attractions are implementing two-tiered pricing systems for visitors and locals.

title.children: Japan's tourist hot spots introduce two-tiered pricing systems for visitors and locals

image.altText: A group of people sitting at a table, holding up drinks and smiling. They are wearing aprons, but no other clothes.

props.synopsis: A community in New South Wales gets undressed to help its beloved aged care facility. The town of 2,000 people raised nearly $350,000 through fundraising efforts to reopen the centre for its elderly.

title.children: Town strips down to save its local aged care centre

image.altText: a graphic with one half showing a pav with kiwifruit and the other half with strawberries.

props.synopsis: Australians and New Zealanders have been fighting over which nation invented the pavlova for years. Let's settle this debate once and for all.

title.children: A deep dive into where the pavlova dessert came from

image.altText: Two bowls of lemon delicious topped with cream, with the baked lemon pudding and serving cream sitting along side them.

props.synopsis: Whether you're in the mood for a self-saucing pudding, or a no-chop fruit crumble, we have plenty of delicious options made from pantry ingredients.

title.children: Just desserts: These six treats are a delicious way to warm up

image.altText: A security guard tries to grab a pitch invader, who has grabbed onto Cristiano Ronaldo

props.synopsis: Cristiano Ronaldo enters the record books yet again, but pitch invaders make the Portuguese legend's afternoon uncomfortable, while contenders for worst miss and own goal of Euro 2024 emerge. Here are your five quick hits.

title.children: Euro 2024 quick hits: Ronaldo's surprising new record, pitch invader woes and the worst own goal of the tournament

image.altText: A graphic of a woman with brown hair and a piggy bank against a teal-coloured background.

props.synopsis: The average superannuation balance at retirement for people from non-English speaking backgrounds is about 30 per cent lower than the general population.

title.children: Why migrants are $140,000 worse off than people born in Australia

image.altText: A man with a beard in a blue shirt learning on a tractor.

props.synopsis: Nuclear reactors, if they are built, will be in the backyards of farmers such as Darren Jensen. He's thrilled by the prospect, but not everyone in town is.

title.children: Nuclear power could put these tiny towns in the national spotlight, but residents' opinions are divided

image.altText: A young man holds large white crates of fresh green produce in each hand.

props.synopsis: An armful of salad greens in exchange for a restaurant dinner is what's on offer for local backyard growers at a northern Tasmanian hub where 'ultra seasonal' is the fare.

title.children: At a Tasmanian restaurant, diners can barter home veggies for restaurant meals in regenerative tourism model

props.synopsis: Now in her 100th year, Lois Whistler has spent all of her life, except for a short period in the 1930s, in one of Australia's most remote island communities.

title.children: At 99, Lois is an eyewitness to more than half of all human history on Lord Howe Island

image.altText: A person covers themselves with a blanket while lying in bed covered with tissues.

props.synopsis: Skip your 1,000th re-watch of Friends and instead use these TV shows and films to ease your sickly little heart.

title.children: Sick at home and bored out of your mind? Here are five films and shows that will get you through

image.altText: Taylor Swift takes a selfie with Prince William, Prince George and Charlotte, all smiling excitedly

props.synopsis: A behind-the-scenes photo shows William posing for a selfie with Swift, alongside his two oldest children, Prince George and Princess Charlotte, at the opening night of the singer's Eras Tour in London.

title.children: 'Off to a splendid start': Taylor Swift shares photo with Prince William as she kicks off her Eras tour in London

image.altText: A woman smiling broadly while hugging her daughter, who has her eyes closed and is smiling and embracing her mum

props.synopsis: A multi-generational storytelling night held each month in Melbourne and Sydney invites women to share stories on topics ranging from My Best Mistake: Stories of Wrongs That Went Right to the upcoming salon Coming of Age: Stories of Wising Up. Audiences say they walk away feeling inspired.

title.children: Some stories are discouraged from being shared publicly. Generation Women breaks down those taboos

image.altText: Shiny monolith stands tall in las vegas

props.synopsis: A strange monolith found jutting from the rocks in a remote mountain range near Las Vegas has been taken down by authorities.

title.children: Another shiny monolith has popped up, this time in Las Vegas. What's going on?

image.altText: Australian Opposition Leader Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton has claimed his nuclear energy plan will cost a fraction of Labor's pursuit of renewable energy.

title.children: Dutton claims nuclear energy will cost fraction of Labor's renewable energy plan

image.altText: A wide scene of police in a suburban street

props.synopsis: As police investigate why Ryan Cole allegedly shot his neighbour on a suburban street in Mackay, new details have emerged about Natalie Frahm's frightening final moments and her accused killer's past filled with loss.

title.children: Accused killer Ryan Cole seemed like a friendly boat enthusiast to his neighbours. Few knew his backstory

image.altText: A man smiling in a boxing gym holding a drink and with clenched fist

props.synopsis: Sydney driver, Bradley Wilkinson, allegedly killed Rhyce Harding by forcefully holding him against a moving vehicle, court documents show.

title.children: Sydney driver allegedly killed Rhyce Harding by 'intentionally and forcefully' holding him against moving vehicle

image.altText: A girl standing in front of a black board.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old vocational school student from rural China becomes a celebrity on social media after reaching the final round of a maths competition, beating many others from top universities and raising questions about the education system.

title.children: Vocational school student stuns China by besting university competitors in a maths contest

image.altText: A man places two white banners with red and black writing on balcony fencing.

props.synopsis: Barcelona announced on Friday that it will bar apartment rentals to tourists by 2028, an unexpectedly drastic move as it seeks to rein-in soaring housing costs and make the city liveable for residents.

title.children: Top Spanish tourist destination plans to scrap holiday rentals

image.altText: An overhead shot of thousands of pilgrims. There is a mosque building to the left and trees in the centre.

props.synopsis: Almost 2 million people attended the pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia this year, as temperatures soared past 50 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Egypt to prosecute companies for organising illegal hajj trips, after hundreds die

image.altText: Ajla Tomljanovic clenches both fists, smiles and looks upwards in celebration

props.synopsis: Ajla Tomljanovic reaches her first grass court final in the Birmingham Classic and is in line for the biggest triumph of her career.

title.children: Ajla Tomljanovic through to first grass court final as stirring career comeback continues

image.altText: New emotions (L-R) Embarrassment (Paul Walter Hauser), Anxiety (Maya Hawke), Envy (Ayo Edebiri), Ennui (Adèle Exarchopoulos).

props.synopsis: Many moments from Inside Out 2 could help spark a conversation with your child about the complex emotions that are normal when growing up.

title.children: Got your own Riley at home? Here's how Inside Out 2 can help you support your child through tricky new emotions
